publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: When first the Squire and Tinker Wood
Gravely consulting Irelands good,
Together mingled in a Mass
Smiths dust with Copper, Lead, & Brass,
The mixture thus by Chymick Art
United close in ev'ry part,
In fillets rolld or cutt in peices
Appeard like one continu'd Species,
And by the framing Engine struck
On all the same impression took;
So to confound this hated Coyn
All partys and Religions joyn,
Whigs, Torys, Trimmers, Hanoverians,
Quakers, Conformists, Presbyterians,
Scotch, Irish, English, French Unite
With equal Int'rest, equal Spight,
Together mingled in a lump
Do all in our Opinion Jump,
And every one begins to find
The same impression on his mind.
A strange Event! whom Gold invites
To Warr and Bloodshed, Brass unites;
So Goldsmiths say the coarsest stuff
Will serve for Sodder well enough.
So by the Kettles loud alarm
The Bees are gatherd to a storm;
So by the brazen Trumpets bluster
Troops of all Tongues & Nations Muster;
And So the harp of Ireland brings
Whole Crowds about its brazen strings.There is a chain lett down from Jove,
But fasten'd to his Throne above,
So strong, that from the lower end
(They say) all human things depend;
This Chain, as ancient Poets hold,
When Jove was young was made of Gold;
Prometheus once this Chain purloynd,
Dissolv'd and into money coynd,
Then Whips me on a Chain of brass;
(Venus was brib'd to lett it pass)
Now while this brazen Chain prevaild
Jove saw that all Devotion fail'd,
No Temple to his Godship raisd,
No Sacrifice on Altars blazd;
In short, such dire confusion followd,
Earth must have been in Chaos swallowd;
Jove stood amaz'd, and looking round,
With much ado the Cheat he found,
'Twas plain, he could no longer hold,
The World in any Chain, but Gold;
And to the God of wealth his Brother
Sent Mercury to gett another:
Prometheus on a Rack is layd,
Ty'd with the Chain himself had made,
On Icy Caucasus to shiver,
Whilst Vultures eat his growing Liver.Ye pow'rs of Grubstreet make me able
Discreetly to apply this Fable;
Say──Who is to be understood
By that old Theif Prometheus?──Wood.
For Jove, it is not hard to guess him,
I mean His Maj────God bless him;
This Theif the Blacksmith was so bold,
He strove to steal that Chain of Gold,
Which links the Subject to the King,
And change it for a brazen string;
But sure, if nothing else must pass
Between the K──and Us, but Brass,
Altho' the Chain will never crack,
Yet Our Devotion may grow slack.But Jove will soon convert, I hope,
This brazen Chain into a Rope,
With which Prometheus shall be ty'd
And high in Air forever ride:
Where if We find his Liver grows,
Instead of Vultures We have Crows.344-174F
